original: @250a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @250a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pa ra ma na gu ru dharm'a r'a dza sto tra n'a ma /
analyzed: pa ra ma na gu ru dharm'a r'a dza sto tra n'a ma /
translated: Paramanguru Dharmarajastotram Nama

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: bla ma dam pa chos kyi rgyal po la bstod pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: bla ma dam pa chos kyi rgyal po la bstod pa zhes bya ba /
translated: Praise to the Holy Guru, the King of Dharma

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels

original: rab rgyas rta yi dpung gi dba' rlabs phreng ba mtho zhing zhags pa ral gri mdung rnon gyis //
analyzed: rab rgyas rta yi dpung gi dba' rlabs phreng ba mtho zhing zhags pa ral gri mdung rnon gyis //
translated: With a high garland of waves of a vast horse army, and with a lasso, sword, and sharp spear,

original: chu la rgyu ba rab mang 'jigs rung rnga chen sgra ldan hor zhes bya ba dus mtha' yi //
analyzed: chu la rgyu ba rab mang 'jigs rung rnga chen sgra ldan hor zhes bya ba dus mtha' yi //
translated: The terrifying, loud-sounding, great drum of the ocean, called Ho, at the end of time,

original: chu gter 'di ni mtha' dag mkhas pa'i bla ma gang gi zur mig rol pas 'jig rten rnams //
analyzed: chu gter 'di ni mtha' dag mkhas pa'i bla ma gang gi zur mig rol pas 'jig rten rnams //
translated: This entire ocean is destroyed by the sidelong glance of the wise guru.üîΩFor the sake of peace, may the Dharma King, who pacifies the world in the supreme way of the Victorious Ones, be victorious.

original: zhi slad rab mchog rgyal ba'i tshul la zhi mdzad chos kyi rgyal po de ni rgyal gyur cig / nub phyogs bod kyi ri la shin tu dri med 'char ba thob cing shar phyogs dag gi yul //
analyzed: zhi slad rab mchog rgyal ba'i tshul la zhi mdzad chos kyi rgyal po de ni rgyal gyur cig / nub phyogs bod kyi ri la shin tu dri med 'char ba thob cing shar phyogs dag gi yul //
translated: Having attained the state of being extremely pure, rising in the western Tibetan mountains, in the eastern lands,

original: rim pas mnan pa gang gi rmongs pa las skyes shin tu rab rgyas mun pa bcom byas nas //
analyzed: rim pas mnan pa gang gi rmongs pa las skyes shin tu rab rgyas mun pa bcom byas nas //
translated: Having gradually overcome the darkness that arises from the delusion of those to be tamed,

original: sems can byang chub grong khyer phyin slad chos gsung 'od zer dra bas rab mtshungs sangs rgyas la //
analyzed: sems can byang chub grong khyer phyin slad chos gsung 'od zer dra bas rab mtshungs sangs rgyas la //
translated: May the Buddha, who is equal to the net of illusions of the light rays of the Dharma,üîΩThe supreme king of the Dharma, who is endowed with a garland of light rays, be victorious.

original: rab tu gsal mdzad chos kyi rgyal po mchog gi 'od zer phreng ldan de ni rgyal gyur cig / gnyis ldan mtha' dag skye bo rnams la phan pa bgyid slad rgyun du rab mchog rgyal ba yi //
analyzed: rab tu gsal mdzad chos kyi rgyal po mchog gi 'od zer phreng ldan de ni rgyal gyur cig / gnyis ldan mtha' dag skye bo rnams la phan pa bgyid slad rgyun du rab mchog rgyal ba yi //
translated: For the sake of benefiting all beings of the two times, the supreme Victor,

original: khyu mchog sems can dag la brten gang rdzogs ldan la ni rkang pa bzhi dang gsum gang la //
analyzed: khyu mchog sems can dag la brten gang rdzogs ldan la ni rkang pa bzhi dang gsum gang la //
translated: The bull among men, who is based on beings, has four feet in the age of completeness, and three in the age of three stories.

original: rkang pas mnan dang gnyis ldan dag la rkang zung gis rgyu rtsod la rkang gcig lhag ma can //
analyzed: rkang pas mnan dang gnyis ldan dag la rkang zung gis rgyu rtsod la rkang gcig lhag ma can //
translated: In the age of two feet, he has two feet, and in the age of strife, he has one foot remaining.

original: gang gis sa la rdzogs ldan bzhin du rgyu mdzad chos kyi rgyal po de ni @250b rgyal gyur cig / gang zhig 'jig rten dag nas gzhi 'byung po 'dzin byed nyi ma dag kyang 'jig rten ni //
analyzed: gang gis sa la rdzogs ldan bzhin du rgyu mdzad chos kyi rgyal po de ni @250b rgyal gyur cig / gang zhig 'jig rten dag nas gzhi 'byung po 'dzin byed nyi ma dag kyang 'jig rten ni //
translated: He who is the support of the world, the sun that rises in the world,

original: snang ba dag nang ldan par byed cing sprin rnams char pa 'bebs byed rlung yang g-yo //
analyzed: snang ba dag nang ldan par byed cing sprin rnams char pa 'bebs byed rlung yang g-yo //
translated: Who makes the light of the world shine, and sets the clouds raining, and sets the winds moving,

original: zla ba bdud rtsi'i rgyun ni rnam par spro byed nam mkha'i go skabs sbyin la rab tu dpa' //
analyzed: zla ba bdud rtsi'i rgyun ni rnam par spro byed nam mkha'i go skabs sbyin la rab tu dpa' //
translated: Who is the hero who gives the space of the sky, and spreads the stream of nectar of the moon,

original: de bzhin chos kyi rgyal pos zol med snying rje sems can kun la rab tu 'jug par byed //
analyzed: de bzhin chos kyi rgyal pos zol med snying rje sems can kun la rab tu 'jug par byed //
translated: In the same way, the Dharma King, without deceit, enters into all beings with compassion.

original: bla ma dam pa chos kyi rgyal po la bstod pa /üîΩrgya gar gyi pandi ta snyan ngag mkhan chen po lakshm'i ka ras sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa chos kyi rgyal po la bstod pa / rgya gar gyi pandi ta snyan ngag mkhan chen po lakshm'i ka ras sbyar ba'o //
translated: Praise of the Holy Master, the Dharma KingüîΩby the Indian poet Lak·π£mƒ´kara

original: pandi de nyid dang / lo ts'a ba shong ston gyis dpal sa skya'i gtsug lag khang du bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: pandi de nyid dang / lo ts'a ba shong ston gyis dpal sa skya'i gtsug lag khang du bsgyur ba'o /
translated: By the same pa·πá·∏çita and the translator Shong ston Rdo rje rgyal mtshan at the glorious Sa skya monastery.
